intro: Ecbolium willdenowii, commonly known as the slender false nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the family Urticaceae, which includes stinging nettles, and features heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive glandular surface. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, and it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. Ecbolium willdenowii is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks, where it thrives in nutrient-rich soils. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for ecological and botanical studies.
